page.title: 06GISLEHAM TOXIC WASTE PIT
page.content: This pit is situated at G.R. 530 888 to the west of the A 12 and the holiday camp. It is used for the disposal of {industrial} toxic liquid waste. Originally a gravel pit, it has been in use for approximately fifteen years and has been a source of growing controversy amongst local residents. Some people regard the pit as a {health} hazard. The holiday camp gate man complained of abnoxious smells emanating from the site. He maintained that the water was travelling by underground streams. The groundsman had experienced a sudden gushing, like a geyser, on one occasion and had been overcome by fumes. We observed a peculiar oil on the southern boundary but could not positively identify it. The pit is quite small and is well screened from the road.
